sentences.en: "How can that be?" asked Hunt, irritated by the obscurity of Henry's reply.
sentences.cn: “怎么会那样呢？”亨特问道，亨利含糊费解的回答让他恼火。

sentences.en: At this time he knew nothing of Wells’s and Matthew’s accounts of natural selection; indeed, both accounts languished in obscurity until after the “Origin” was published.
sentences.cn: 此时他对马修和威尔士关于自然选择的阐述一无所知；事实上，直到《物种的起源》发表这两人一直默默无闻。

sentences.en: For the lucky few, there's the chance of being plucked from obscurity and thrown into the glamorous world of modelling.
sentences.cn: 只有极少数幸运儿才有机会从籍籍无名中脱颖而出，进入光鲜亮丽的模特圈。

sentences.en: He has risen from obscurity to international fame.
sentences.cn: 他已从默默无闻之辈而成为国际上的名人.

sentences.en: He moved to New York where he lived in obscurity , working as a Customs Inspector.
sentences.cn: 他移居纽约, 在海关谋得个检查员职务,无声无息地过活.

sentences.en: His prose is vigorous and dense, occasionally to the point of obscurity.
sentences.cn: 他的散文文笔有力、内容庞杂，有时几近晦涩。

sentences.en: Iowa and New Hampshire are not doomed to obscurity quite yet.
sentences.cn: 然而,爱荷华和新罕布什尔的地位也并非注定黯淡.

sentences.en: It is the custom to consider that wit lies in obscurity.
sentences.cn: 现在人们都把晦涩当成聪明.

sentences.en: Letitia pondered on an obscurity in these words.
sentences.cn: 利蒂霞思索着这些话中的费解之处.

sentences.en: Now, on the eve of the bicentenary of the independence movements, he sets out to rescue San Martín from his relative obscurity.
sentences.cn: 今天，在那场独立运动二百周年纪念前夕，他再度出手以挽救相对默默无闻的圣·马丁。

sentences.en: O’Brien died in obscurity.
sentences.cn: 奥布莱恩默默无闻地死去。

sentences.en: obscurities in the text
sentences.cn: 文中的难解之处

sentences.en: She rose from obscurity to stardom.
sentences.cn: 她从无名之辈一跃成为明星。

sentences.en: The actress was only 17 when she was plucked from obscurity and made a star.
sentences.cn: 这个演员受到提携从无名少女一跃成为明星时年仅17岁。

sentences.en: The agency plucked Naomi from obscurity and turned her into one of the world's top models.
sentences.cn: 这个经纪公司挖掘了默默无闻的娜奥米，并把她打造成了世界顶尖模特。

sentences.en: The group produced two albums before disappearing into obscurity.
sentences.cn: 这个团体发行两张专辑后就淡出乐坛。

sentences.en: The latter half of his life was spent in obscurity and loneliness.
sentences.cn: 他在默默无闻中孤独地度过了后半生。

sentences.en: The obscurity of JTS is in some sense due to its own success: because it hides the details of transaction management so effectively, we don't hear or say very much about it.
sentences.cn: 在某种意义上，JTS 的默默无闻恰恰是它的成功：因为它非常有效地隐藏了事务管理的很多细节，因此，我们没有听说过或者谈论过很多关于它的内容。

sentences.en: The obscurity of the passage makes several interpretations possible.
sentences.cn: 这段文字隐晦,因而有可能作出好几种解释.

sentences.en: There is another form of wilful obscurity that masquerades as aristocratic exclusiveness.
sentences.cn: 还有一种故意造成的含糊其词,用以掩盖其贵族老爷式的孤傲态度.

sentences.en: They would have continued to struggle against economic odds and would have lived in obscurity.
sentences.cn: 这家人会继续为克服经济上的拮据而奋斗,并默默无闻地活下去.

sentences.en: This kind of obscurity is not only pretentions; it is short - sighted.
sentences.cn: 这种含糊其词不仅显得自命不凡, 而且缺乏远见.

words.tran_cn: 朦胧；阴暗；晦涩；身份低微；不分明

trans.tran_cn: 朦胧，晦涩，默默无闻，费解
trans.tran_en: the state of not being known or remembered
